articles.title: Businesses turning to agentic AI to grow, scale and ease work pressure
articles.description: Businesses across Australia and New Zealand are turning to a new generation of artificial intelligence technology to lighten the load.
articles.content:
As pressure mounts on organisations to improve productivity and scale their operations, businesses across Australia and New Zealand are turning to a new generation of artificial intelligence (AI) technology to lighten the load.

articles.title: OpenAI debuts its GPT-4.1 flagship AI model
articles.description: OpenAI has introduced GPT-4.1, a successor to the GPT-4o multimodal artificial intelligence model launched by the company last year.
articles.content: OpenAI has introduced GPT-4.1, a successor to the GPT-4o multimodal artificial intelligence model launched by the company last year. During a livestream on Monday, OpenAI said GPT-4.1 has an even larger context window and is better than GPT-40 in “ju... [2075 chars]

articles.title: Google reveals AI model to help decipher dolphin speech
articles.description: The online giant has revealed its new artificial intelligence model DolphinGemma, which will be used to analyse how dolphins communicate.
articles.content:
Google has announced a new artificial intelligence (AI) model that will help scientists study how dolphins communicate.
The tech giant collaborated with Georgia Tech and the field research of the Wild Dolphin Project (WDP) to build the new machine-le... [1512 chars]

articles.title: From spreadsheets to strategy: how AI rewrites the rules of treasury
articles.description: The latest advances in artificial intelligence and machine learning are helping solve the complex challenges corporate treasurers face.
articles.content:
The latest advances in artificial intelligence and machine learning are helping solve the complex challenges corporate treasurers face by providing real-time visibility of cash and liquidity positions, rich data insights and precision forecasting.

articles.title: Future legislation compensating news outlets for content must account for AI: report
articles.description: TORONTO — Canadian researchers say any future legislation meant to level the playing field between Big Tech and journalism organizations must account for generative artificial intelligence.
articles.content:
